title: Understanding SQL WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause in SQL is used to filter records. It is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.

title: Using NOT EQUAL Operator
text: In SQL, the NOT EQUAL operator is represented by $$ \neq $$ or <>. It is used to exclude records that match a certain condition.

hintAnswer: SELECT EmployeeName FROM Employees WHERE Department $$ \neq $$ 'Sales';
title: Formulating the SQL Query
text: Write an SQL query to select all employees except those in the 'Sales' department.

title: Alternative SQL Syntax
text: Another way to write the NOT EQUAL condition in SQL is using the <> operator. For example, WHERE Department <> 'Sales'.
